thread.title: Detroit Lions practice: Haloti Ngata back; Ihedigbo, Pettigrew out
thread.title_full: Detroit Lions practice: Haloti Ngata back; Ihedigbo, Pettigrew out

author: freep.com
title: Detroit Lions practice: Haloti Ngata back; Ihedigbo, Pettigrew out
text:
MORE The Detroit Lions could be getting one of their best run defenders back this weekend, just in time to face the NFL's best running back.
Defensive tackle Haloti Ngata was back on the practice field today, after missing two games with a strained calf.
The Lions, who rank 26th in the NFL against the run (120.7 yards per game), host Adrian Peterson and the Minnesota Vikings at Ford Field on Sunday (1 p.m., Fox).
"Obviously, a guy that big with that kind of experience against a team that runs the ball a lot, there's no question he can help us," Lions coach Jim Caldwell said.
Along with Ngata, defensive end Jason Jones returned to practice today, after leaving last weekend's win over the Chicago Bears with a neck injury. Tight end Eric Ebron practiced after sitting out the last two games with a knee injury.
Tight end Brandon Pettigrew (knee), safety James Ihedigbo (quadriceps), nickel back Josh Wilson and linebacker DeAndre Levy did not practice for the Lions. Levy is out, likely for the year, following hip surgery.
DETROIT FREE PRESS
Lions' Levy back walking after hip surgery
